projects.name: Bayou Bolt
projects.subtitle: Bayou Bolt is a New Orleans themed 2D scrolling jumping platform tiny game. It is inspired by Super Mario. Bayou Bolt is coded in Lua and designed with Pico-8 for its sprite and map editor.

projects.name: Frog Soup
projects.subtitle: Frog Soup is a game created with Bitsy.org.

projects.name: Dodge the Cracks
projects.subtitle: Dodge the Cracks is a game created with Vanilla JavaScript, HTML, and CSS. It was inspired by the  game, Flappy Bird.

projects.name: Frustrating Phone Number Enter-er
projects.subtitle: This frustrating, but functional, phone number enter-er was built with HTML, CSS, and Javascript. It was inspired by combining the concepts of Wild-West carnival games and rotary phones into one shooting game.

projects.name: CRyder and Dirty Beets Informational Webpage
projects.subtitle: CRyder and Dirty Beets is a local band in Colorado. They asked me to build them an informational webpage. I used HTML, CSS, and Javascript to create this site. I conducted UX Research to determine the best layout and design for their site and branding.

projects.name: Zane McMorris Personal Portfolio
projects.subtitle: Zane McMorris is an electrical computer engineer at CU Boulder. He asked me to build him a personal portfolio where he can show off his projects.  I used HTML, CSS, and Javascript to create this site.

projects.name: Recipe Search + Grocery List App
projects.subtitle: This app allows its users to search Spoonacular's API and find recipes. The user can add the ingredients from the recipe to their grocery list and mark when completed. They can also delete items from their grocery list. The grocery list is stored in Swift Data. The app also has a widget that allows the user to open the grocery list directly.

projects.name: Dinosaur Calculation App
projects.subtitle: DinoMatch is an app to compare your height and speed to a dinosaur. You can also take the dinosaur personality quiz to see which dinosaur you are most like. The app was built with Swift and Xcode.

projects.name: Natural Highs App Prototype
projects.subtitle:
One of the projects I have been working on is a prototype app for Natural Highs, a nonprofit organization dedicated to teaching healthy alternatives to substances. I utilized Figma to make the prototype.

The app is a social media page for the nonprofit. You create an account where you input your information and demographics. When you sign up, you automatically follow all the main pages (Boulder, Canada, Australia) and all the registered peer mentors from your community. After signing in, the app automatically loads the feed page. From there, you can navigate throughout the app. There is an events page where you can scan a QR code to check in for each event. After checking in, users are asked to fill out a survey with the information needed for Natural Highs to apply for grants. The app has a database holding the demographics of each user along with their answers to surveys.

projects.name: Wonderland Mirror-Puzzle Maze
projects.subtitle: I developed a VR puzzle maze, inspired by the Queen of Heart's maze and palace from Alice in Wonderland. I was inspired by Portal. I used Unity, C#, and a Meta Quest 3.

projects.name: Martian Shooter
projects.subtitle: I developed a VR shooting game with Unity, C#, and a Meta Quest 3.

projects.name: Chart Generator from Spreadsheet
projects.subtitle: I developed this website to generate a chart with data from an uploaded spreadsheet. I used Svelte and Node.js to build this chart generator. I used Firebase to store user's login credentials and uploaded files. I called chart.js to convert the spreadsheets to charts.

projects.name: React.js Meal Planner
projects.subtitle: I used React.js to build a meal planner. The app allows users to input their meals and ingredients for the week and populate their meal plan with it with an easy drag and drop feature. I collabotated with Wolfgang Loudenburg to build this app.
